subtitle.Text: Steve: One of our favorite movies is The Apartment, which was directed by Billy Wilder, and it starred Shirley MacLaine, and Jack Lemmon, and it's from, like... 1960?
And it's basically what Mad Men is, except actually from that time. Karla: Yeah.
Steve: It's super good. And there's this weird kind of humorous vocal tic that some of the executives in the movie have, where they will refer to something...
they'll say like, "We're doing quite well, dividends-wise!" or something, and Shirley MacLaine's character is named...
her last name is Kubelik and one of the executives at different times says something like, "So how are you getting along, Kubelik-wise?"
So anyway, super deeply buried easter egg reference in-joke, we made the law firm Kubelik and Wise, that prepared Oscar's will, just as a little wink-and-nod, a little Harcourt Fenton...
Steve: But yeah, The Apartment, you should watch it. Karla: It's damn .... It's totally worth your time, it's a really good movie.
